name: Access and Authorization with IAM module
title: Access and Authorization with IAM module
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IAM/pages/1066369115 - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

The IAM project does not tackle authorization or access rights. The focus of the IAM module is authentication. (also see Business Decisions )

The specific authorization rules of EFS and Portals still apply. As they are tightly coupled to the business cases of the applications they can currently not be handled by a mire generic IdP like Okta and also not by a clientâ€™s Identity Provider.

Therefore every user that is able to login at Okta is a valid authenticated user. Thus every application has to take care that authenticated users are only allowed to access the resources they are assigned to. A user that is not known by an application should be rejected.
